geometric¶

geometric.Dislocation¶

class pymls.geometric.Dislocation(lattice: Lattice, hkl: ndarray, uvw: ndarray, phi: float, SGno: int | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: Lattice

Slip reference frame for the slip system {hkl}<uvw> and geometric aspects of the dislocation contrast factor.

Reference¶

Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, & Scardi (2009) “Diffraction contrast factor of

dislocations.” Acta Cryst A65, 109-119.

Gijmn(s: ndarray) → ndarray[source]¶

Geometric component of the dislocation contrast factor.

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}G_{ijmn} = \tau_i \tau_j \tau_m \tau_n,\\(i,m) \in 1,2,3,\\(j,n) \in 1,2.\end{aligned}\end{align} \]
Parameters:

s (np.ndarray (3,)) – Diffraction vector s.

Returns:

  • rv (np.ndarray (3,2,3,2)) – Geometric component of the dislocation contrast factor.

  • Reference

  • ———

  • Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, & Scardi (2009) “Diffraction contrast factor of

  • dislocations.” Acta Cryst A65, 109-119. eqn. 10

property P: ndarray¶
\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}\left[ e_1 e_2 e_3 \right] = P \left[i j k \right]\\and\\P = \xi_{ij}\end{aligned}\end{align} \]
Returns:

  • np.ndarray (3,3)

  • Reference

  • ——— – NB MLS (2009) type this in row-major format

property Rp2: ndarray¶

Rotation determined by axis \(\chi_2\) and angle \(\phi\).

Returns:

Rotation matrix transforming Burgers vector b into the line vector l.

Return type:

np.ndarray (3,3)

Reference¶

Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, & Scardi (2009) “Diffraction contrast factor of

dislocations.” Acta Cryst A65, 109-119. eqns. 5-6.

property SG: int¶

Space group number.

property burgers: ndarray¶

Alias of self.uvw.

property e: ndarray¶

…

Returns:

  • np.ndarray (3,3) – Dislocation reference frame.

  • Reference

  • ———

  • Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, & Scardi (2009) “Diffraction contrast factor of

  • dislocations.” Acta Cryst A65, 109-119. eqn. 8

property e1: ndarray¶

Dislocation reference frame 1.

property e2: ndarray¶

Dislocation reference frame 2.

property e3: ndarray¶

Dislocation reference frame 3.

property hkl: ndarray¶

Miller indices of slip plane.

property line: ndarray¶

Line vector defined \(R_{p2} \cdot \vec{b}\).

property phi: float¶

Angle between dislocation line and Burgers vector describes dislocation character, \(\phi\). [1]

“The vector l is obtained by rotating the Burgers vector b clockwise by an angle phi (dislocation character) around e2.” [2]

Reference¶

[1] Wilkens, M. (1970). The determination of density and distribution of

dislocations in deformed single crystals from broadened X‐ray diffraction profiles. Physica Status Solidi (A), 2(2), 359–370. https://doi.org/10.1002/pssa.19700020224

[2] Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, and Scardi (2009). Diffraction contrast

factor of dislocations. Acta Cryst. A65, 109–119.

t1(s: tuple) → float[source]¶

Direction cosine between the diffraction vector s and \(e_1\).

t2(s: tuple) → float[source]¶

Direction cosine between the diffraction vector s and \(e_2\).

t3(s: tuple) → float[source]¶

Direction cosine between the diffraction vector s and \(e_3\).

tau(s: ndarray) → ndarray[source]¶

Direction cosines between diffraction vector s and slip reference system.

\[\tau_i = \vec{s^*}/s^* \cdot \vec{e}_i\]
Parameters:

s (np.ndarray (3,)) – Diffraction vector.

Returns:

Vector of direction cosines.

Return type:

np.ndarray (3,)

property uvw: ndarray¶

Miller indices of slip vector.

visualize() → tuple[source]¶

Returns:

(fig, ax) – (matplotlib.figure, matplotlib.axis).

Return type:

tuple
